OnTime

  1. We use Axosoft's Ontime 2009 to manage tasks in our design and rapid turn-around teams, and manage our backlog in there too. From that point on it's all physical - multiple jumbo whiteboards and lots of cards stuck on with tack. We're lucky to have the whole team colocated, and we like the social stuff that happens when you have a real board to gather around and physical story cards to move across it. And the perform the 'information radiator' function very well, in my opinion, better than an online system would do.
